availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James O. Thomas (Cumberland County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Cumberland County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of James Thomas and M. Thomas. Married to Mary M. Thomas Thomas in Adair County, Kentucky, on August 25, 1853. Father of Elizabeth E. Thomas, Samantha M. Thomas, and Louisa Ann Thomas. Farmer in Cumberland County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Cumberland County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Cumberland County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, Cumberland Division, p. 319A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District 1, p. 624.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Cumberland County, District 1, p. 362A.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Adair County Marriages, Film 005560860.
